metadata.job_title: Senior Data Engineer â€“ Commerce Data Pipelines

data_maturity_score.evidence: Mentions modern tools (Snowflake, Redshift, Airflow) and data quality frameworks, but no explicit governance, monitoring, or CI/CD practices. Focus on ETL and performance tuning suggests defined but not managed maturity.

data_maturity_level.evidence: Matches score of 3 - documented processes around ETL, data modeling, and quality checks, but no advanced governance or optimization signals.

maturity_signals.evidence: Explicitly mentions Snowflake/Redshift (modern warehouse), Airflow (orchestration), and Data Quality frameworks. No CI/CD, monitoring, or governance tools mentioned.

scope_creep_score.evidence: Role is clearly focused on data engineering (ETL, modeling, SQL tuning) with no mention of ML, analytics, or DevOps responsibilities. No scope creep detected.

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Hybrid model (4 days onsite), fast-paced environment, and 10-month contract suggest moderate pressure. No PTO or work-life balance signals mentioned to mitigate risk.

role_clarity.evidence: Well-defined responsibilities around ETL pipelines, data modeling, and SQL tuning. No vague or multi-role descriptions.

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Low scope creep, clear role, but moderate overtime risk and contract nature (10 months) increase overall risk slightly. No severe red flags.

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: No information about reporting manager or team structure in job posting or Pass 1/2.

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No manager title or level mentioned in job description or extracted data.

team_growth_velocity.evidence: No information about team growth, hiring velocity, or expansion plans in job posting.

team_composition.evidence: No details about team size, composition, or seniority mix provided in job posting.

reporting_structure.evidence: No reporting structure (CTO, Director, Manager, etc.) mentioned in job description.

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Mentions partnering with business, analytics, and infrastructure teams, but no indication of embedded cross-functional product teams. Suggests centralized data team.

work_life_balance_score.evidence: Hybrid model (4 days onsite) and fast-paced environment suggest moderate work-life balance. No PTO, unlimited time off, or flexibility mentioned to improve score.

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: No mention of learning budget, conferences, mentorship, or career paths. Contract role (10 months) limits growth opportunities.

tech_culture_score.evidence: Modern stack (Snowflake, Airflow) and focus on data quality suggest decent tech culture. No mention of code reviews, CI/CD, or innovation practices.

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open source, tech blogs, conference speaking, hackathons, or innovation time.

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of code review, CI/CD, testing, monitoring, or design docs in job description.

innovation_signals.evidence: No mention of R&D, experimentation, or innovation culture.

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No mention of tech debt management, refactoring, or code quality improvement initiatives.

ai_integration_level.evidence: No mention of ML, AI, MLOps, or GenAI in job description or Pass 1/2. Focus is purely on ETL and data pipelines.

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML tools (SageMaker, MLflow, etc.) mentioned in job description.

hiring_urgency.evidence: 10-month contract and hybrid model suggest urgency to fill role quickly, but no explicit 'ASAP' or 'immediate start' mentioned.

competition_level.evidence: Hybrid role in major US cities (Seattle, Santa Monica, NYC) with 10-month contract may attract moderate competition. No application count or Easy Apply mentioned.

company_stage_inferred.evidence: Contract role, hybrid model, and focus on commerce data suggest early-stage startup. No explicit funding stage mentioned, but 3+ years experience requirement aligns with Series A/B.

hiring_velocity.evidence: 10-month contract suggests temporary or backfill role rather than aggressive expansion. No mention of multiple open roles or team growth.

team_size_signals.evidence: No information about data or engineering team size in job posting.

funding_stage_signals.evidence: No mention of funding stage, investors, or financial status in job description.

role_creation_type.evidence: 10-month contract suggests temporary or replacement role rather than new headcount or team expansion.

strengths: Clear, focused data engineering role with modern stack (Snowflake, Airflow)
Hybrid work model with Friday remote flexibility
concerns: 10-month contract limits long-term stability and growth opportunities
No visa sponsorship (H1B, OPT, CPT excluded) restricts candidate pool
Moderate overtime risk due to fast-paced environment and onsite requirement
best_fit_for: Contract data engineers seeking short-term, high-paying roles
Candidates with 3+ years ETL experience in Snowflake/Redshift environments
Those comfortable with hybrid work and US work authorization
red_flags_to_probe: Ask about actual work hours and weekend expectations in fast-paced environment
Clarify if contract can be extended or converted to FTE
Understand team structure and reporting manager level
negotiation_leverage: Strong SQL tuning and ETL optimization skills are high-value for this role
Experience with both Snowflake and Redshift provides flexibility and leverage
summary.overall_assessment: Solid contract opportunity for senior data engineers with ETL expertise, offering competitive pay and modern tools. Main drawbacks are short-term nature (10 months), no visa sponsorship, and moderate work pressure. Best for candidates seeking temporary, high-paying roles with clear responsibilities.
